title: Authors and Citation
text: Sarah Zeller. Author, maintainer.

title: Authors and Citation
text: Zeller S (2023). donutsR: Running donut analyses. R package version 1.0.0.0, https://szeller42.github.io/donutsR/.
code: @Manual{,   title = {donutsR: Running donut analyses},   author = {Sarah Zeller},   year = {2023},   note = {R package version 1.0.0.0},   url = {https://szeller42.github.io/donutsR/}, }

title: Running donut analyses
text: set R functions complement masters thesis. , analyze effect landfills nearby population. vary 2 parameters: inner radius defines dummy variable interest, living close landfill. outer radius excludes population lives far landfill.  package, one can create donut_lists: lists regressions varying inner outer radius. also functions interpret regressions.

title: Running donut analyses
text: Run following line R install package: remotes::install_github("szeller42/donutsR")

title: Running donut analyses
text: donut_models creates donut_list. plot_significance plots summary one parameter interest. donut_summary outputs modelsummary table, specifically tailored donut_models. donut_models takes data frame distance parameter dist_km, determines distance relevant geometry rows. also takes two distance vectors: inner radius (inner) outer (outer). function performs feols regression clustered standard errors. outputs donut_list, includes additional list element distance parameters. Additional parameters can used following robustness checks: Landfill-cluster-bootstrapped standard errors treatment dummy Conley standard errors independent variables Excluding n largest clusters Excluding observations within k distance-units landfills

title: Running donut analyses
text: example used package can found . online appendix masters thesis, analyse impact landfills residents. analysis, plots tables built package.

what: Perform a Donut FE analysis — donut_analysis
title: Perform a Donut FE analysis — donut_analysis
text: Performs single FE-models given data set. independent variable population can adjusted.

title: Perform a Donut FE analysis — donut_analysis
code: donut_analysis(   dist,   ds,   dep_var,   indep_vars,   fe = "id",   dist_var = "dist_km",   se = "cluster",   bootstrap = FALSE,   B = 9999,   lat = "lat",   lon = "lon",   excl_largest_fe = 0,   excl_inner_r = 0,   treatment_label = "Lives close to landfill",   ... )

title: Perform a Donut FE analysis — donut_analysis
text: dist vector two distances: inner outer. inner distance refers maximum distance treatment. outer distance refers overall population: cut-value. ds dataset. dep_var dependent variable regression indep_vars character vector independent variables. Must part ds. fe character vector Fixed Effects variables. Must part ds. dist_var character referring distance parameter. Defaults dist_km. se character, defaulting cluster. shows adjust standard errors: clustering fe param (cluster), adjustment, (basic), Conley (conley). regressions rely fixest. bootstrap boolean: standard errors dist bootstrapped? B number bootstraps lat Latitude; needed conley-standard errors lon Longitude; needed conley-standard errors excl_largest_fe Numeric: many FE largest number observations excluded? Defaults 0. excl_inner_r Numeric. observations closest fe omitted: radius omitted? Defaults 0. treatment_label Character. label treatment variable created combination inner outer radius. Defaults "Lives close landfill" ... Additional arguments

title: Perform a Donut FE analysis — donut_analysis
text: single donut_model object class fixest. donut_model additional list element contain inner outer radii additional info. can plotted plot_significance function, showed table donut_summary.

title: Perform a Donut FE analysis — donut_analysis
code: data(donut_data) model1 <- donut_analysis(dist = c(5, 20),                ds = donut_data,                dep_var = "wealth_index",                indep_vars = "age",                fe = "id") model2 <-   donut_analysis(dist = c(8, 50),                  ds = donut_data,                  dep_var = "wealth_index",                  indep_vars = c("age", "male"),                  fe = "id",                  dist_var = "dist_km",                  excl_largest_fe = 2,                  excl_inner_r = 1) model_basic <-   donut_analysis(dist = c(8, 50),                  ds = donut_data,                  dep_var = "wealth_index",                  indep_vars = c("age", "male"),                  fe = "id",                  dist_var = "dist_km",                  se = "basic")

title: Randomly generated data — donut_data
text: data set donut_analysis functions can used.

title: Randomly generated data — donut_data
code: donut_data

title: Randomly generated data — donut_data
text: object class data.frame 100000 rows 7 columns.

title: Randomly generated data — donut_data
text: #' @format ## donut_data data frame 100,00 rows 7 columns: dist_km Distance nearest point interest wealth_index wealth index observation male, age gender age household head id ID number point interest lat, lon position observation

what: Perform a Donut FE analysis — donut_models
title: Perform a Donut FE analysis — donut_models
text: Performs single FE-models given data set. independent variable population can adjusted.

title: Perform a Donut FE analysis — donut_models
code: donut_models(inner = 3:9, outer = (1:5) * 10, ds, indep_vars, ...)

title: Perform a Donut FE analysis — donut_models
text: inner vector inner radii. outer vector outer radii ds dataset indep_vars independent variables pass donut_analysis ... Additional arguments

title: Perform a Donut FE analysis — donut_models
text: donut_models list: donut_list

title: Perform a Donut FE analysis — donut_models
code: data(donut_data) models <- donut_models(inner = 2:4, outer = c(10, 20), ds = donut_data, dep_var = "wealth_index", indep_vars = "age", fe = "id")

what: Model summary table for donut_list — donut_summary
title: Model summary table for donut_list — donut_summary
text: Convenience function make modelsummary table. Input needs list donut_analysis models, .e. donut_list.

title: Model summary table for donut_list — donut_summary
code: donut_summary(   donut_list,   filter_80 = TRUE,   title = NULL,   hist = TRUE,   r_inner = NULL,   sort_variables = TRUE,   output,   format_numbers = TRUE,   ... )

title: Model summary table for donut_list — donut_summary
text: donut_list donut_list filter_80 regressions treated <=80% shown? Defaults true. title Optional: title summary table. Defaults "Regression results (r_inner km radius)". hist donut_list clustered standard errors: histogram clusters shown? r_inner inner radius; optional. (vector ) integers inner radius donut_model. Must donut_list. sort_variables variables sorted "dist" top? Logical. Currently, supported se options "basic". output output modelsummary, e.g. kableExtra modelsummary_list. Note modelsummary_list gets additional list elements input information get lost. format_numbers Logical. numbers formatted thousands separated comma? ... Optional arguments histogram modelsummary

title: Model summary table for donut_list — donut_summary
text: modelsummary object, usually kableExtra table.

title: Model summary table for donut_list — donut_summary
code:
data(donut_data) models <- donut_models(inner = 2:4, outer = c(10, 20), ds = donut_data, dep_var = "wealth_index", indep_vars = "age", fe = "id") table <- donut_summary(donut_list = models, r_inner = 3, height = 200) #> Warning: The `x` argument of `as_tibble.matrix()` must have unique column names if #> `.name_repair` is omitted as of tibble 2.0.0. #> ℹ Using compatibility `.name_repair`. #> ℹ The deprecated feature was likely used in the donutsR package. #> Please report the issue to the authors. library(modelsummary) model_not_donut <- feols(age ~ male | id, data = donut_data, vcov = "cluster") modelsummary(model_not_donut) #> #> #> #> #> #> #> #> #> #> #> #> #> #> #> #> #> #> #> #> #> #> #> #> #> #> #> #> #> #> #> #> #> #> #> #> #> #> #> #> #> #> #> #> #> #> #> #> #> #> #> #> #> #> #> #> #> #>

model_w_bootstrap <- donut_models(inner = 2:4, outer = c(10, 20), ds = donut_data, dep_var = "wealth_index", indep_vars = "age", fe = "id", bootstrap = TRUE) #> Warning: Please note that the seeding behavior for random number generation for #> `boottest()` has changed with `fwildclusterboot` version 0.13. #> #> It will no longer be possible to exactly reproduce results produced by versions #> lower than 0.13. #> #> If your prior results were produced under sufficiently many bootstrap #> iterations, none of your conclusions will change. For more details about this #> change, please read the notes in #> [news.md](https://cran.r-project.org/web/packages/fwildclusterboot/news/news.html). #> This warning is displayed once per session. #> Too guarantee reproducibility, don't forget to set a global random seed #> **both** via `set.seed()` and `dqrng::dqset.seed()`. #> This message is displayed once every 8 hours. donut_summary(model_w_bootstrap, r_inner = 4) #> #> #> #> #> #> #> #> #> #> #> #> #> #> #> #> #> #> #> #> #> #> #> #> #> #> #> #> #> #> #> #> #> #> #> #> #> #> #> #> #> #> #> #> #> #> #> #> #> #> #> #> #> #> #> #> #> #> #> #> #> #> #> #> #> #> #> #> #> #> #> #> #> #>

#> 2 Numbers in brackets refer to the number of treated clusters
models_list <- list(model_w_bootstrap, models) |> unlist(recursive = FALSE) donut_summary(models_list, r_inner = 3) #> #> #> #> #> #> #> #> #> #> #> #> #> #> #> #> #> #> #> #> #> #> #> #> #> #> #> #> #> #> #> #> #> #> #> #> #> #> #> #> #> #> #> #> #> #> #> #> #> #> #> #> #> #> #> #> #> #> #> #> #> #> #> #> #> #> #> #> #> #> #> #> #> #> #> #> #> #> #> #> #> #> #> #> #> #> #> #> #> #> #> #> #> #> #> #> #> #> #> #> #> #> #> #> #>

title: Running donut analyses — donutsR
text: package, can run donut analyses: regressions distance parameter, used create treatment dummies, determine population.

title: Running donut analyses — donutsR
text: Sarah Zeller

what: Extract additional info from donut_analysis model — extract_info
title: Extract additional info from donut_analysis model — extract_info
text: Convenience function extract distances well number treated, observations, original observations, percentage treated, clusters, treated clusters donut_analysis model. Input needs (list ) donut_analysis models.

title: Extract additional info from donut_analysis model — extract_info
code: extract_info(models)

title: Extract additional info from donut_analysis model — extract_info
text: models List donut_analysis models, single donut_analysis model

title: Extract additional info from donut_analysis model — extract_info
text: tibble

title: Extract additional info from donut_analysis model — extract_info
code: data(donut_data) model <- donut_analysis(dist = c(5, 20), ds = donut_data, dep_var = "wealth_index", indep_vars = "age", fe = "id", clust = TRUE, bootstrap = FALSE) extract_info(model) #> # A tibble: 1 × 8 #>   name  inner outer n_treated n_obs perc_treated n_clust n_clust_treated #>   <chr> <dbl> <dbl>     <int> <int>        <dbl>   <int>           <int> #> 1 value     5    20      2264 30762       0.0736      20              20

what: Extract distances from donut_analysis model — plot_significance
title: Extract distances from donut_analysis model — plot_significance
text: Convenience function extract distances donut_analysis model. Input needs (list ) donut_analysis models. Consider adding theme(legend.text.align = 1) right-align p-value legend.

title: Extract distances from donut_analysis model — plot_significance
code: plot_significance(   donut_models,   var,   filter_80 = TRUE,   p_value,   dep_var,   se = NULL,   ... )

title: Extract distances from donut_analysis model — plot_significance
text: donut_models List donut_analysis models var dependent variable donut_analysis models plotted. filter_80 Boolean: regressions displayed treatment group >= 80% whole population? Defaults TRUE. p_value Alternative donut_models: already ready p-value data set. dep_var p_value param chosen: dependent variable. Character. se p_value chosen: standard errors corrected. Character. ... additional parameters passed ggplot

title: Extract distances from donut_analysis model — plot_significance
text: ggplot2 plot

title: Extract distances from donut_analysis model — plot_significance
code: data(donut_data) models <- donut_models(inner = 2:4, outer = c(10, 15, 20), ds = donut_data, dep_var = "wealth_index", indep_vars = "age", fe = "id") plot <- plot_significance(models, var = "dist") plot  plot$data |> plot_significance(p_value = _, var = "dist", dep_var = "wealth_index", se = "Clustered standard errors.")

code: sentence_case(x)

text: Prettifies variables labels, sorts "dist" front

code: sorted_vars(donut_list)
